metadata.name: Potential Suspicious Registry File Imported Via Reg.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects the import of '.reg' files from suspicious paths using the 'reg.exe' utility

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\reg.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('reg.exe') AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' import ')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('c:\\users\\')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('%temp%')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('%tmp%')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('%appdata%')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('\\appdata\\local\\temp\\')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('c:\\windows\\temp\\')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('c:\\programdata\\'))))

output.summary: Detects the import of '.reg' files from suspicious paths using the 'reg.exe' utility

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate import of keys Reference: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-server/administration/windows-commands/reg-import
